results.title: To compare anti-albumin urea effects of valsartan alone with combination of valsartan and amlodipine in patients of chronic kidney disease
results.text_hl: @CHEMICAL_Valsartan @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000068756 @@@Valsartan@@@ and @<m>CHEMICAL_Amlodipine</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017311 @@@Amlodipine@@@ combination is associated with significant reduction in @<m>DISEASE_Albuminuria</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D000419 @@@albuminuria@@@ as compare to @CHEMICAL_Valsartan @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000068756 @@@Valsartan@@@ alone.

citations.NLM: Ameen, Kashif MA, Sumreen. To compare anti-albumin urea effects of valsartan alone with combination of valsartan and amlodipine in patients of chronic kidney disease Pak J Med Sci. 2016 May-Jun;32(3):613-6. PMID: 27375700
citations.BibTeX: @article{27375700, title={To compare anti-albumin urea effects of valsartan alone with combination of valsartan and amlodipine in patients of chronic kidney disease}, author={Ameen and Kashif MA and Sumreen}, journal={Pak J Med Sci}, volume={32}, number={3}, pages={613-6}}

results.title: Benidipine reduces albuminuria and plasma aldosterone in mild-to-moderate stage chronic kidney disease with albuminuria.
results.text_hl: It may be concluded that @CHEMICAL_benidipine @CHEMICAL_MESH:C061004 @@@benidipine@@@ results in a greater reduction of plasma @CHEMICAL_Aldosterone @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000450 @@@aldosterone@@@ and @<m>DISEASE_Albuminuria</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D000419 @@@albuminuria@@@ than @<m>CHEMICAL_Amlodipine</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017311 @@@amlodipine@@@, and that these effects are independent of BP reduction.

citations.NLM: Abe M, Okada K, Maruyama N, Matsumoto S, Maruyama T, Fujita T, Matsumoto K, Soma M. Benidipine reduces albuminuria and plasma aldosterone in mild-to-moderate stage chronic kidney disease with albuminuria. Hypertens Res. 2011 Feb;34(2):268-73. PMID: 21124330
citations.BibTeX: @article{21124330, title={Benidipine reduces albuminuria and plasma aldosterone in mild-to-moderate stage chronic kidney disease with albuminuria.}, author={Abe M and Okada K and Maruyama N and Matsumoto S and Maruyama T and Fujita T and Matsumoto K and Soma M}, journal={Hypertens Res}, volume={34}, number={2}, pages={268-73}}

results.title: Effects of the N/L-Type Calcium Channel Blocker Cilnidipine on Nephropathy and Uric Acid Metabolism in Hypertensive Patients With Chronic Kidney Disease (J-CIRCLE Study)
results.text_hl: In the present study, we first reproduced the @<m>DISEASE_Albuminuria</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D000419 @@@albuminuria@@@-lowering effect of @CHEMICAL_cilnidipine @CHEMICAL_MESH:C065927 @@@cilnidipine@@@ in the clinical practice of family physicians and then looked into the changes in @CHEMICAL_Uric_Acid @CHEMICAL_MESH:D014527 @@@uric acid@@@ metabolism by this drug as compared with @<m>CHEMICAL_Amlodipine</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017311 @@@amlodipine@@@.

citations.NLM: Uchida S, Takahashi M, Sugawara M, Saito T, Nakai K, Fujita M, Mochizuki K, Shin I, Morita T, Hikita T, Itakura H, Takahashi Y, Mizuno S, Ohno Y, Ito K, Ito T, Soma M. Effects of the N/L-Type Calcium Channel Blocker Cilnidipine on Nephropathy and Uric Acid Metabolism in Hypertensive Patients With Chronic Kidney Disease (J-CIRCLE Study) J Clin Hypertens (Greenwich). 2014 Oct;16(10):746-53. PMID: 25264215
citations.BibTeX: @article{25264215, title={Effects of the N/L-Type Calcium Channel Blocker Cilnidipine on Nephropathy and Uric Acid Metabolism in Hypertensive Patients With Chronic Kidney Disease (J-CIRCLE Study)}, author={Uchida S and Takahashi M and Sugawara M and Saito T and Nakai K and Fujita M and Mochizuki K and Shin I and Morita T and Hikita T and Itakura H and Takahashi Y and Mizuno S and Ohno Y and Ito K and Ito T and Soma M}, journal={J Clin Hypertens (Greenwich)}, volume={16}, number={10}, pages={746-53}}

results.title: Albuminuria and transferrinuria in essential hypertension. Effects of antihypertensive therapy.
results.text_hl: @CHEMICAL_Fosinopril @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017328 @@@Fosinopril@@@ lowered @<m>DISEASE_Albuminuria</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D000419 @@@albuminuria@@@ in all @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@, whereas @<m>CHEMICAL_Amlodipine</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017311 @@@amlodipine@@@ only in half of @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@.

citations.NLM: Alli C, Lombardo M, Zanni D, Agrati AM, Cassani M, Granata S. Albuminuria and transferrinuria in essential hypertension. Effects of antihypertensive therapy. Am J Hypertens. 1996 Nov;9(11):1068-76. PMID: 8931831
citations.BibTeX: @article{8931831, title={Albuminuria and transferrinuria in essential hypertension. Effects of antihypertensive therapy.}, author={Alli C and Lombardo M and Zanni D and Agrati AM and Cassani M and Granata S}, journal={Am J Hypertens}, volume={9}, number={11}, pages={1068-76}}

results.title: T/L-type calcium channel blocker reduces the composite ranking of relative risk according to new KDIGO guidelines in patients with chronic kidney disease
results.text_hl: The decrease in @<m>DISEASE_Albuminuria</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D000419 @@@albuminuria@@@ in the @CHEMICAL_benidipine @CHEMICAL_MESH:C061004 @@@benidipine@@@ group was significantly lower than in the @<m>CHEMICAL_Amlodipine</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017311 @@@amlodipine@@@ group.

citations.NLM: Abe M, Okada K, Suzuki H, Yoshida Y, Soma M. T/L-type calcium channel blocker reduces the composite ranking of relative risk according to new KDIGO guidelines in patients with chronic kidney disease BMC Nephrol. 2013 Jul 1;14():135. PMID: 23815742
citations.BibTeX: @article{23815742, title={T/L-type calcium channel blocker reduces the composite ranking of relative risk according to new KDIGO guidelines in patients with chronic kidney disease}, author={Abe M and Okada K and Suzuki H and Yoshida Y and Soma M}, journal={BMC Nephrol}, volume={14}, pages={135}}

results.title: [Calcium channel blocking agents and albuminuria in diabetic and hypertensive patients. A pilot study].
results.text_hl: Since estimated glomerular pressure is identical in @<m>CHEMICAL_Amlodipine</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017311 @@@amlodipine@@@ treated and @CHEMICAL_Diltiazem @CHEMICAL_MESH:D004110 @@@diltiazem@@@ treated subjects, differences in @<m>DISEASE_Albuminuria</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D000419 @@@albuminuria@@@ may be explained by different renal tubular reabsorption rates.

citations.NLM: Lamarre-Cliche M, Lambert R, Van Nguyen P, Cusson J, Wistaff R, Larochelle P. [Calcium channel blocking agents and albuminuria in diabetic and hypertensive patients. A pilot study]. Arch Mal Coeur Vaiss. 2000 Aug;93(8):919-24. PMID: 10989730
citations.BibTeX: @article{10989730, title={[Calcium channel blocking agents and albuminuria in diabetic and hypertensive patients. A pilot study].}, author={Lamarre-Cliche M and Lambert R and Van Nguyen P and Cusson J and Wistaff R and Larochelle P}, journal={Arch Mal Coeur Vaiss}, volume={93}, number={8}, pages={919-24}}

results.title: Amlodipine Reduces Inflammation despite Promoting Albuminuria in the Streptozotocin-Induced Diabetic Rat
results.text_hl: However, these beneficial effects of @<m>CHEMICAL_Amlodipine</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017311 @@@amlodipine@@@ on @<m>DISEASE_Albuminuria</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D000419 @@@albuminuria@@@ are not universal, as studies in @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ with @DISEASE_Renal_Insufficiency_Chronic @DISEASE_MESH:D051436 @@@chronic kidney disease@@@ and @DISEASE_Hypertension @DISEASE_MESH:D006973 @@@hypertension@@@ reported no effect or even an increase in @<m>DISEASE_Albuminuria</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D000419 @@@albuminuria@@@ following treatment with @<m>CHEMICAL_Amlodipine</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017311 @@@amlodipine@@@.

citations.NLM: Flynn ER, Marbury DC, Sawyer RT, Lee J, Teutsch C, Kauser K, Maric-Bilkan C. Amlodipine Reduces Inflammation despite Promoting Albuminuria in the Streptozotocin-Induced Diabetic Rat Nephron Extra. 2012 Jan;2(1):205-18. PMID: 22811694
citations.BibTeX: @article{22811694, title={Amlodipine Reduces Inflammation despite Promoting Albuminuria in the Streptozotocin-Induced Diabetic Rat}, author={Flynn ER and Marbury DC and Sawyer RT and Lee J and Teutsch C and Kauser K and Maric-Bilkan C}, journal={Nephron Extra}, volume={2}, number={1}, pages={205-18}}

results.title: Comparison of losartan and amlodipine in renally impaired hypertensive patients.
results.text_hl: The greater antihypertensive response to @CHEMICAL_Losartan @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019808 @@@losartan@@@ was not influenced by the initial degree of @<m>DISEASE_Albuminuria</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D000419 @@@albuminuria@@@. The @CHEMICAL_Losartan @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019808 @@@losartan@@@ and @<m>CHEMICAL_Amlodipine</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017311 @@@amlodipine@@@ regimens were well-tolerated.

citations.NLM: Fernández-Andrade C, Russo D, Iversen B, Zucchelli P, Aranda P, Guerra L, Casado S. Comparison of losartan and amlodipine in renally impaired hypertensive patients. Kidney Int Suppl. 1998 Dec;68():S120-4. PMID: 9839295
citations.BibTeX: @article{9839295, title={Comparison of losartan and amlodipine in renally impaired hypertensive patients.}, author={Fernández-Andrade C and Russo D and Iversen B and Zucchelli P and Aranda P and Guerra L and Casado S}, journal={Kidney Int Suppl}, volume={68}, pages={S120-4}}

results.title: Combined aliskiren and amlodipine reduce albuminuria via reduction in renal inflammation in diabetic rats.
results.text_hl: Combined @CHEMICAL_aliskiren @CHEMICAL_MESH:C446481 @@@aliskiren@@@ and @<m>CHEMICAL_Amlodipine</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017311 @@@amlodipine@@@ reduce @<m>DISEASE_Albuminuria</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D000419 @@@albuminuria@@@ via reduction in @DISEASE_Inflammation @DISEASE_MESH:D007249 @@@renal inflammation@@@ in @DISEASE_Diabetes_Mellitus @DISEASE_MESH:D003920 @@@diabetic@@@ @SPECIES_10116 @@@rats@@@.

citations.NLM: Matavelli LC, Huang J, Siragy HM. Combined aliskiren and amlodipine reduce albuminuria via reduction in renal inflammation in diabetic rats. J Cardiovasc Pharmacol. 2012 Mar;59(3):281-7. PMID: 22075749

results.title: Enalapril/amlodipine combination in cyclosporine-treated renal transplant recipients: a prospective randomized trial.
results.text_hl: @CHEMICAL_Enalapril @CHEMICAL_MESH:D004656 @@@enalapril@@@ alone (n = 33) and vs. @<m>CHEMICAL_Amlodipine</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017311 @@@amlodipine@@@ alone (n = 34) on arterial pressure, renal function, @<m>DISEASE_Albuminuria</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D000419 @@@albuminuria@@@ and tolerability.

citations.NLM: Halimi JM, Giraudeau B, Buchler M, Al-Najjar A, Etienne I, Laouad I, Bruyère F, Lebranchu Y. Enalapril/amlodipine combination in cyclosporine-treated renal transplant recipients: a prospective randomized trial. Clin Transplant. 2007 Mar-Apr;21(2):277-84. PMID: 17425758
